solution.text:
Initial weight = 2kg
Its weight increases by a power of 2 each year.
Hence in one year, its weight would be the square of the initial weight.
Hence weight after one year is \( (2^2) \) = 4kg
Now weight after 2 years is the square of the weight after a year.
Hence weight after 2 years is \( (4^2) \) = 16kg
Hence weight after 2 years is 16 kg.

content.text: A new born bear weighs 2 kg. How many kilograms might a two year old bear weigh if its weight increases by the power of 2 each year?
